name: Bark, Dennis Laistner
title: Emeritus Senior Fellow
ngos: Chairman, Board of Trustees, Earhart Foundation; Member, Board of Directors, United States Institute of Peace
notes: Political scientist and historian specializing in European affairs and transatlantic relations. Author or editor of nine books. Awarded Knight's Cross of the Order of Merit, First Class, by Germany (1997) and Knight's Cross of the National Legion of Honor by France (2001). PhD summa cum laude from the Free University of Berlin. Papers archived at Hoover Institution Archives.

name: Castellini, Robert H.
title: Principal Owner and Managing General Partner
political_donations: Donations to Bush-Cheney '04 ($2,000, 2003); Castellini family donated $14,000 to Kentucky Gov. Matt Bevin (2019); Castellini Co PAC contributions totaling $333,150 in 2024 cycle. Also donated $2,000 to Democratic Gov. Andy Beshear (January 2022).
ngos: Chairman: Cincinnati Business Committee, TriHealth, Good Samaritan Hospital, Cincinnati Zoo, Queen City Club; Board member: 3CDC, Cincinnati Art Museum, National Underground Railroad Freedom Center, Xavier University, Denison University, Babson College
notes: Built Castellini Company (fresh produce distribution) into one of the largest privately held companies in the region as Chairman before purchasing majority ownership of the Cincinnati Reds in 2006 for $270 million. Previously held minority stakes in the Texas Rangers (1989) and Baltimore Orioles (1993).

name: Classen, Willard J. Jr.
notes: Mineral rights holder in Walnut Creek, CA area (28 mineral interests across 2 counties on file).

name: Fournier, Dudley J. Jr.
title: Senior Broker
notes: Property and casualty insurance broker based in Mill Valley, California. Attended University of California, Berkeley (1975-1980).

name: Hudner, Philip
title: Of Counsel
ngos: President, Charles D. & Frances K. Field Fund; Trustee, Louise M. Davies Foundation; Former member, Board of Directors, Independent Institute; Former head, Society of California Pioneers
notes: Born February 24, 1931 in San Jose, California. Attorney specializing in estate planning and administration. Previously Partner at Pillsbury, Madison & Sutro LLP (1958-1999). Rancher in San Benito County, California since 1970. Graduated Stanford University (A.B.) and Stanford Law School (LL.B.). Family has been in agriculture and legal profession in San Juan Bautista since 1847.

name: Hudnut, Thomas C.
title: Educational Consultant
ngos: Board member: four foundation boards (medical, educational, public interest); former President, The Headmasters Association; former President, Country Day School Headmasters' Association; former President, Cum Laude Society; former President, California Association of Independent Schools; California Horse Racing Board (appointed by Gov. Gavin Newsom, reappointed January 2026)
notes: School head for 36 years. President of Harvard-Westlake School, Los Angeles, 1987-2013 (the first headmaster after the October 1989 merger). Previously headmaster at Branson School, CA (1982-1987) and Norwood School, MD. Magna cum laude graduate of Princeton; Master's from Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy, Tufts. Beverly Hills resident.

name: Jackson, Peter
title: Owner
notes: Based in Santa Barbara, California. Associated with Mariposa Company LLC.

name: Kempner, Michael
title: Founder and Chief Executive Officer
political_donations: Major Democratic donor and fundraiser. Bundled $1,623,658 for Hillary Clinton's 2008 campaign and $880,547 for Barack Obama. Donated $50,000 to Organizing for Action (2013). Total FEC donations to Democratic candidates over $419,000 since 1985. Also received PPP loan enforcement action from Justice Department.
ngos: Broadcasting Board of Governors (appointed by President Obama, confirmed December 2014); active in numerous Democratic Party fundraising committees
notes: Born January 31, 1958. Founded MikeWorldWide in 1986, now one of the largest independent PR firms globally. National Finance co-chair for Hillary Clinton's 2008 presidential campaign. Deputy Finance Chair of the Democratic National Committee. PRWeek's PR Pro of the Year (2015). Named to PRWeek Hall of Fame (2020).

name: LaGrande, Kenneth M.
employer: The LaGrande Family Food Group / Sun Valley Rice
title: Founder and Chief Executive Officer
ngos: Board member: USA Rice Millers Association; Board member: Vigilant; Former Chairman of the Board, Tehama-Colusa Canal Authority; YPO (Young Presidents' Organization) member
notes: Fifth-generation rice farmer in Sacramento Valley, California. Holds a B.S. in Finance from Santa Clara University and completed the Agribusiness Seminar at Harvard Business School Executive Education. Co-founded Sun Valley Rice with his father. Longtime activist for California water issues. Author of A Rice Conversation.

name: Lake, Peyton Myers
notes: Mineral rights holder in Tyler, TX (4 mineral interests across 6 counties on file). Also associated with Burleson Partners, LLC (Tyler, TX).

name: Lindberg, Eric John Jr.
title: Chairman of the Board
ngos: Cal Poly Rodeo Board; California Rangeland Trust; Past Chapter Chair, YPO Golden Gate Chapter (San Francisco)
notes: More than three decades of leadership at Grocery Outlet. Co-CEO from January 2006-December 2018, CEO January 2019-December 2022, Interim President and CEO October 2024-February 2025, Chairman of the Board since January 2023. Under his leadership, Grocery Outlet grew store count by 259% and revenues by 484%.

name: Merriman, Dwight L. III
employer: Ares Management / Ares Real Estate Group
title: Partner and Head of Industrial (retired February 2025)
ngos: Member, Urban Land Institute (ULI); Member, NAIOP (Commercial Real Estate Development Association)
notes: More than 25 years of real estate investment and development experience. Founder and CEO of Black Creek Group LLC (2010), specializing in industrial real estate. Joined Ares Management in 2021. Acquired more than $9 billion of commercial real estate during career. Retired from Ares board effective February 1, 2025. B.S. from University of Southern California; MBA from UCLA Anderson School.

name: Mondavi, Robert Michael Jr.
employer: Michael Mondavi Family Estate / Folio Fine Wine Partners
title: Founder and President of Winemaking
notes: Fourth-generation Napa Valley winemaker, born 1971, son of Michael Mondavi, grandson of Robert Mondavi. Co-founded Folio Fine Wine Partners with father Michael, mother Isabel, and sister Dina in 2004. Previously served as Director of Marketing at Robert Mondavi Corporation. B.A. in English Literature from Santa Clara University. Also on advisory board of Napa Valley Cannabis Association.

name: O'Neill, George D. Jr.
title: Founder
political_donations: George O'Neill Jr. and wife Erica O'Neill donated combined $17,400 to Matt Gaetz's campaign (April 2022). Known contributor to Pat Buchanan's 1992 presidential campaign. Trump supporter since 2016.
notes: Great-grandson of John D. Rockefeller Jr.; sculptor, jewelry maker, and pilot. Manages small family agriculture and construction materials operations in Lake Wales, FL. Identified as 'U.S. Person 2' in the Maria Butina/Russian foreign agent case (hosted a private dinner during the 2017 National Prayer Breakfast attended by Russian central bank head Alexander Torshin). Conservative author; contributor to The American Conservative. Estimated net worth $200 million.

name: Rennick, Mark Eugene
title: Owner and President
notes: Known professionally as Mark 'Mooka' Rennick. Founded Prairie Sun Recording Studios in Cotati, California (1978/1980). Recording studio situated on a 10-acre former chicken farm with three studios. Notable artists recorded include Tom Waits (Bone Machine, 1992 Grammy winner for Best Alternative), Paul McCartney, Van Morrison, Carlos Santana, Huey Lewis and the News, Nine Inch Nails, and many others. Also worked as musician and bass player touring with Commander Cody's Billy C. Farlow in the late 1970s. Attended Sonoma State University.

name: Semple, Lloyd A.
employer: University of Detroit Mercy School of Law (retired)
title: Former Dean (retired 2014)
ngos: Chairman, Detroit Zoological Society; Former Chairman, Board of Detroit Medical Center; Former Vice Chairman, National Audubon Society; Former Chairman, Michigan Chapter of The Nature Conservancy; Former Chairman and CEO, Dykema Gossett PLLC
notes: Born June 7, 1939. Spent 40+ years at Dykema Gossett law firm, serving six+ years as chairman and CEO before retiring in 2004. Joined University of Detroit Mercy law faculty, became dean in 2009. Served as Councilman and mayor pro tempore of Grosse Pointe Farms, Michigan (1975-1983). Specializes in business law and mergers and acquisitions.

name: Starling, Christopher A. USMC (Ret)
title: Executive Director / AVP SkillBridge
ngos: Board of Trustees, San Francisco Maritime National Park Association; Board of Advisors, Veteran Launch; Board member, Main Street Launch; Mentor, Creative Destruction Lab
notes: Colonel (Ret.), USMC. Retired from Marine Corps after 26 years of service as infantry officer. Ten overseas deployments including three combat tours (Operations Desert Shield, Desert Storm, Iraqi Freedom). Commanded 2nd Battalion, 2nd Marines (Camp Lejeune) and 23rd Marine Regiment (San Bruno, CA). National Security Affairs Fellow, Hoover Institution, 2007-2008. Testified before Congress (June 22, 2023) on veteran employment in cybersecurity. B.A. in Modern Languages, Virginia Military Institute; M.P.A., City University of New York.

name: Vinson, Donald E.
title: Founder and Chairman
ngos: Former Board of Directors and Executive Committee, U.S. Chamber of Commerce (1995-2000); Former Chairman, Institute for Legal Reform, U.S. Chamber of Commerce
notes: Widely credited as the 'founding father' of the trial consulting industry. Invented modern jury research with his 'shadow jury' concept developed for IBM in the mid-1970s. Founded Litigation Sciences, Inc. and DecisionQuest. Former Professor at UCLA Graduate School of Management (Associate Professor of Marketing) and USC Graduate School of Business (Chairman, Department of Marketing). Visiting Professor of Law, Tulane University. Also founded Vinson Litigation Finance (also known as Vinson Resolution Management). Appointed by California Governor Pete Wilson to California Commission on Judicial Performance. Participates in Federalist Society events.
